main_definition: In the context of idioms, 'plates' refers to burdens or responsibilities that one has to manage.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A metaphorical reference to multiple tasks or responsibilities that need attention and management, like plates stacked on a shelf
meanings_and_examples.example: After finishing his work for the day, John felt as though he was carrying a whole set of plates upstairs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression to describe a situation where everything seems to be going wrong at once, similar to dropping several plates all at once
meanings_and_examples.example: The team experienced a series of unfortunate events today, as if they were trying to balance too many plates.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiom that suggests having more tasks or responsibilities than one can handle comfortably, like carrying too many dishes
meanings_and_examples.example: Sarah has a lot on her plate right now with her job and taking care of the kids.
